parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: (a) I say, speak; I mean, mention, tell, (b) I call, name, especially in the pass., (c) I tell, command.

parse: Article - Accusative Neuter Singular
str2: The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Adjective - Accusative Neuter Singular
str2: Third. Ordinal from treis; third; neuter a third part, or a third time, thirdly.

parse: Noun - Vocative Masculine Singular
str2: Simon. Of Hebrew origin; Simon, the name of nine Israelites.

parse: Noun - Genitive Masculine Singular
str2: Of Hebrew origin; Joannes, the name of four Israelites.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: From philos; to be a friend to (an individual or an object), i.e. Have affection for; specially, to kiss.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.

parse: Noun - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: Peter, a Greek name meaning rock. Apparently a primary word; a rock; as a name, Petrus, an apostle.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To pain, grieve, vex. From lupe; to distress; reflexively or passively, to be sad.

parse: Conjunction
str2: Neuter of hostis as conjunction; demonstrative, that; causative, because.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: Answer, bid, bring word, command. A primary verb; to speak or say.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Adjective - Accusative Neuter Singular
str2: Third. Ordinal from treis; third; neuter a third part, or a third time, thirdly.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: From philos; to be a friend to (an individual or an object), i.e. Have affection for; specially, to kiss.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.

parse: Noun - Vocative Masculine Singular
str2: Lord, master, sir; the Lord. From kuros; supreme in authority, i.e. controller; by implication, Master.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Nominative 2nd Person Singular
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.

parse: Verb - Perfect Indicative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: To know, remember, appreciate.

parse: Adjective - Accusative Neuter Plural
str2: All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: Answer, bid, bring word, command. A primary verb; to speak or say.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Nominative 2nd Person Singular
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: A prolonged form of a primary verb; to 'know' in a great variety of applications and with many implications.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: From philos; to be a friend to (an individual or an object), i.e. Have affection for; specially, to kiss.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 2nd Person Singular
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.

parse: Noun - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: (a) I say, speak; I mean, mention, tell, (b) I call, name, especially in the pass., (c) I tell, command.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Verb - Present Imperative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: To feed, pasture. A prolonged form of a primary verb; to pasture; by extension to, fodder; reflexively, to graze.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.

parse: Noun - Accusative Neuter Plural
str2: A sheep. Probably neuter of a presumed derivative of probaino; something that walks forward, i.e., a sheep.
